Legal_Issue: Application of the standard of proof, credibility assessment, and consideration of evidence
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to alleged persecution in Kenya
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; Board's decision upheld
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Negative credibility findings, procedural fairness, legal error
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, timeliness of evidence, plausibility of inferences
Credibility_Assessment: Based on plausible inferences; negative credibility findings made by the Board
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Board's decision on judicial review
Governing_Rule: Standard of proof is balance of probabilities; credibility is a factual finding
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to submit evidence in a timely manner
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed persecution in Kenya but was found not credible
Evidence_Handling: Late evidence not considered due to procedural rules
Evidence_Assessment: Board assessed evidence according to procedural and substantive standards
Decision_Rationale: No legal or procedural errors; credibility findings were reasonable
